headline: CNN Newsroom
subHeadline: Alex Murdaugh Cross-Examined For Second Day In His Murder Trial. Aired 2:30-3p ET

utterances.speaker: ALEX MURDAUGH, ACCUSED OF KILLING HIS WIFE AND SON
utterances.sentences: I could see his brain on the -- and I ran over to Maggie.Actually, I think I tried to turn Paul over first. You know, I tried to turn him over. And I don't know how I figured it out. His cell phone popped out of his pocket. I started to try to do something with it thinking maybe -- but then I put it back down really quickly. Then I went to my wife. And, I mean, I could see --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: Mm-mm.Did you touch Maggie at all?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did. I touched them both.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I tried to -- I mean, I tried to do it as limited as possible but I tried to take their pulse on both of them.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: Mm-mm.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And, you know, I called 911 pretty much right away. And she was very good. I talked to her. I told her I was going to get off the phone to call some family members. I did that. And --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: What family members did you call?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I called my brother, Randy. And I called my brother, John. And I tried to call a little boy, real good friend that's right around the corner from here, but I didn't get him.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: OK.What all was around Paul when you walked up? MURDAUGH: Blood.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: Any other -- anything else?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I mean, there was some body things, yes, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: I mean like any other evidence? I know you said the phone fell out of the pocket. But did you see anything else that didn't belong or shouldn't belong or that wasn't part of Paul?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir, not -- no. Not that -- no, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: What about Maggie?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: You didn't see anything around them?What made you come out here tonight?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I went to -- my mom has late-stage Alzheimer's patient. My dad's in the hospital. My mom gets anxious when she does. I went to check on them.And Maggie, Maggie's a dog lover. She fools with the dogs. And I knew she was gone to the kennel. I was at the house. (END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: CREIGHTON WATERS, LEAD PROSECUTOR
utterances.sentences: Just to be clear, you say you hadn't made the conscious decision to start lying about your wife and son's murder right there, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't believe so.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Let's continue on.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Mr. Waters, I can't -- I can't tell you exactly when that decision occurred.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. You can't describe to the jury the moment you decided to lie about your wife and son's murder?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I can't tell you exactly when that moment occurred.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I left the house and went --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You did say earlier that when David Owen asked you about your relationships that was a trigger point, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, that was certainly one of the things that contributed or made me paranoid. WATERS

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Now, you know, there were already things that had gone on that occurred, as I said, that put me in that mindset.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But exactly when I decided to lie about that I can't tell you.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So the things, again, you talked about, your dope paranoia, the fact they had taken GSR, and you talked about the advice of your law partners and Sheriff Hill and Greg Alexander.And then you talked about your distrust of SLED somehow from the circumstances and demeanor of this interview right here, correct?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Ten years ago, right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It was a while back. You know?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You don't know if Dave Owen was at SLED 10 years ago?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. No. I checked on that because, that night, the officer who was involved in that case in bringing clearly manufactured charges against Greg Alexander --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're saying the night before you sat down for this interview you were asking somebody about whether or not -- about Greg Alexander 10 years ago in the wake of what had occurred?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Oh, no. I didn't ask anybody.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. So that wasn't what you were discussing when you were sitting in this car?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No I wasn't discussing that. I'm just telling you that I thought David Owen was the same agent that was involved in that case.Now, I learned later, because I checked on it, I learned later that it was a different David SLED agent, first name David with a different last name. I learned that later. I'm just saying that was all part of that process going on in my mind.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're saying you're sitting right here thinking this Dave Owen and the circumstances and demeanor of this interview, you're thinking that guy had been involved in the prosecution or investigation of your friend 10 years ago.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. So here's a new one you just mentioned to us, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, that's not a new one.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That is part of --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: The circumstances are new.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, no.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That is fairly specific, don't you think?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, no, sir. I -- I --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: The story keeps evolving. Keep going.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. You asked me about this, Mr. Owen. What I said is part of this whole --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I'm not Mr. Owen.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I mean, Mr. Waters. The whole part of this whole process involved my distrust for SLED. That was part of, a big part of my distrust for SLED.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: We can all see it on your face in this interview, can't we?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. But you said, what you just said a little bit ago, that wasn't the lie, the conscious decision yet. So let's keep going.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm not saying that. I'm saying I don't believe that it was.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't know exactly when I made the decision to lie about that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: All right?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: When you see it let me know. OK?Let's go forward.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Just a little while, tried to call her when I left. Texted her, no response. When I got back to the house, the house was -- obviously nobody was in there, so I figured they were still up there fooling around.Paul was going to be getting set up to plant -- our sunflower seeds got sprayed and died and he was refiguring to plant the sunflower seeds.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: So I came back up here and drove up and saw, and called.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Had Maggie and Paul been arguing over anything?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What was their relationship like?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Wonderful.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Wonderful?How about yours and Maggie's?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Wonderful. I mean, I'm sure we had little things here and there, but we had a wonderful marriage, wonderful relationship.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Yours and Paul's relationship?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: As good as it could be.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: How old was Paul?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Twenty-two.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: That line of questioning right there, just asking very general questions about your relationship, you mentioned that before, didn't you, Mr. Murdaugh?Is that the moment right there? Is that the look on your face when you decided to lie about an important fact in your wife and son's murder? [14:40:02] MURDAUGH: I don't know. As I said, Mr. Waters, I don't know the exact point I made that decision.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You specifically, earlier, mentioned that very exchange as somehow triggering you to lie about the last time you saw them alive.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I'm not saying that that's what made me lie. I'm saying this whole set of circumstances caused me to be in a state where I had paranoid thoughts.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That normally, Mr. Waters, I could take a deep breath and make away in a second or two seconds or three seconds at the most. And on this night I wasn't able to do that.But all of those things I mentioned I believe contributed to that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Any more you want to add now since you keep adding?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'd be glad to answer any question you have.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I' mean, I'm asking you. I mean, the factors have gone from yesterday to today, and now even after lunch, we got new ones. So anything else you want to add right now as to factors?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Mr. Waters, I don't believe I've added any new factors. I believe that's what I said yesterday.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I've explained some of those factors because of your questions but I don't believe I've added any factors.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. All right. Let me move this forward just a little bit.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Most of this was stuff from -

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You had talked yesterday in great detail about the boat case you brought up on the 911 call and then Daniel Green and, of course, in this first interview, correct?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did mention the boat wreck.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And you described that. Do you remember what you said in this interview about the boat wreck?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Not specifically.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Not specifically the other people involved in the boat wreck? You don't remember specifically? Do you remember specifically? I guess you said no.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I remember talking about the boat wreck. And I --(CROSSTALK) MURDAUGH: -- talked about the boat wreck.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. I'm going to play it now from 17(BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Any direct threats between any of the people on the boat specifically, but I do think there's been a small amount of yip yap between a couple of them but not recently.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER
utterances.sentences: OK.(END VIDEO CLIP)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. What was the term you used for that? "A small amount of yip yap?"

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes. Just to be clear, Mr. Waters, there was never, ever a point in time where I thought that the people that were involved in the boat wreck did this to Paul Paul and Maggie. I've never thought that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Never thought that but it is literally one of the first things you said out of the 911 call?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. That's not what I said.I never, ever, ever, under any point in time, believed those kids that were riding in that boat or their parents or their families --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I didn't believe that any of the families, the people that were involved in the boat wreck had anything to do with hurting Maggie and Paul.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But I can tell you that, at that time and as I sit here today, that I believe that boat wreck is the reason why Paul Paul and Maggie were killed.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm certain -- I believe that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: It was random vigilantes, the 5-2 vigilantes? Huh?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Because I can tell you for a fact that the person or people who did what I saw on June the 7th, they hated Paul Murdaugh and they had anger in their heart.And that is the only, only reason that somebody could be mad at Paul Paul like that and hate him like that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Got you.All right. So we've got, now -- (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: But that's why I did then believe it was the boat wreck. And I believe now that the boat wreck --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: -- had something to do with it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. So we've got random vigilantes because of the boat wreck.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. I don't know that they're random vigilantes.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You just said it wasn't a family or the kids or the family of the other kids in the boat, right?(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: So you're saying it is somebody off social media. You don't have any evidence of that, do you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You just believe that. And you're telling that jury that as you try to explain the lie you told for the first time yesterday, isn't that right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir. That is not right.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: It's not right.All right. Well, let me ask you a question then. What you're telling this jury is that it is a random vigilante?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's your term. WATERSand Maggie were both at Moselle on June 7th, knew they would be at the kennels alone on June 7th. They knew you would not be there, but only between the times of 8:49 and 9:02, that they show up without a weapon, assuming they'll find weapons and ammunition there, that they commit this crime during that short time window. And then they travel the same exact route that you do around the same time to Alameda. That is what you are trying to tell this jury?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You got a lot of factors in there, Mr. Waters, all of which I do not agree with, but some of which I do.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right.You testified earlier that after this happened -- let me back up just real quick. When you were driving to and from Alameda, why were you in such a hurry? (CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Why were you rolling 70, 80 miles an hour down that dark, beat-up road?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I wasn't in such a hurry.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You weren't?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Showed you what's been marked as State's 573. See if you recognize this.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I do.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Tell the jury what that is.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Mag's car.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What is it in front of?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The house at Moselle.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What is between the house and the Mercedes?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The golf cart.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Is that where it was on June the 8th to your recollection?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Where was it left?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It was near there but that is not exactly where it was, no, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Where was it?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Where would we normally park it would be a little bit closer to the shed. I mean a little bit closer to the house, to the bushes.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: When was that photograph taken?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Do you recognize when it was taken?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No. I don't recognize it, no, sir.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You wouldn't dispute it was around the time in the aftermath of the murders, would you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Aftermath being when?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I'm asking you.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: A day, a week, an hour?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I wasn't there, Mr. Murdaugh.Do you recognize this?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I recognize the car. I recognize the house. And I recognize the golf cart. But that is not -- that is not exactly how it would have been that night.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Well, it would more in line with -- first thing's first is when we drove the golf cart -- or when I drove it for sure, and I believe when the others drove it, you would come in and you would go across the little brick walkway that's in front of this.So if I would have come in and gone this way or I would have come in and gone this way. This is not a place that any of my family would have normally parked. So what I'm assuming is, this obviously was taken the daytime. What I'm assuming is, it was taken when SLED came to the -- the earliest it was taken was when SLED came to the house the next day, which I believe the testimony is in the afternoon. At this point in time, that golf cart, I would assume, would have been moved several times. But that's not how it was.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Well, where did you leave the golf cart when you got out of it around 8

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: In the manner which I just talked about.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Help me out again so I understand. You would have come around this way or that way. But where would it end up?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It would have been -- in this picture, it's facing to the right.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I gotcha.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: The night -- the night that I drove it, I believe I parked it facing to the left.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I understand.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It would be customarily how I did it. And I believe I did it that way that night.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: And that is how I would have gotten into it.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. That's a very specific memory. Thank you.(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right, at this time, the state would offer --

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's just how it normally is.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: -- State's 5739.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED DEFENSE ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: No objection.

utterances.speaker: JUDGE CLIFTON NEWMAN, SOUTH CAROLINA CIRCUIT COURT
utterances.sentences: Admitted without objection.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (INAUDIBLE)

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: You see, Mr. Waters, you can see in the picture now, if you bring this up on screen, if you look to the right, you can see the actual steps. Just to the left of that would be where the little brick patio starts.So I where I would normally park it, you roll across those bricks and the end of the golf cart would be just past those. And we all normally parked it that way, because the way you charge this golf cart is -- if you see that back seat, you can see the edge. This is a three-seat golf cart. You can see the back seat. A lot of golf carts have the charger that sits on the floor or something. This golf cart has the charger that's plugged in and part of the golf cart. So you flip that seat up and it plugs in. And the outlets are right up there by the door. WATERS: OK. Anything else you want to say about that?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I'm going to answer any questions you have, Mr. Waters.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: I appreciate all that information.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED DEFENSE ATTORNEY
utterances.sentences: Objection to the comment.

utterances.speaker: NEWMAN
utterances.sentences: Sustained.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: It's just never parked that way. By the family.

utterances.speaker: BIANNA GOLODRYGA, CNN HOST
utterances.sentences: We're going to take you back to the courtroom in Walterboro, South Carolina, for the testimony of Alex Murdaugh.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't think she got back quite that early. I think she got back a little bit later than that.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Umm --

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: What did you need to do? Were you at the office or --

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I was home. I came home and I messed around. I -- I -- I was up at the house. I laid down, took a nap on the couch, probably, I don't know, 25, 30 minutes.I got up, I called Maggie. Didn't get an answer. And I left to go to my mom's. She said she might ride with me. But she normally doesn't when I go over there. And I think I texted her.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Is it there, when you repeated the lie, that you decided?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Was that the moment that I decided --(CROSSTALK)

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Was that the moment that you decided to lie to Dave Owen?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I don't -- I don't know, as I told you, Mr. Waters, the exact moment I decided to lie. But at that point in time, I -- WATERS

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: I did.And she's very good about answering the phone, so that was odd, or calling me back, so that was odd. But it wasn't that big a deal.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. We'll go to the second interview that's been previously admitted.You said earlier during your direct testimony that, after these crimes happened, you were around family, family was around you, your law partners were around you pretty much every minute after that, correct? "Every waking minute." Didn't you say that yesterday?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Yes. They were for a long time.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right. And this second interview was three days later, is that right?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: That's correct.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: At no time with any of your close friends and law partners and family do you confess the truth, do you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I did not.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: Did you say, hey, man, I think I messed up, what should I do about this?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't.

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're not telling that lie to anyone, are you, until yesterday?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Excuse me?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: You're not telling that lie to anyone until yesterday, are you?

utterances.speaker: MURDAUGH
utterances.sentences: Not telling what lie? Saying I tried to tell somebody that I was lying?

utterances.speaker: WATERS
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
